main event: A bright light was observed by three men at Eyrarbakki, Iceland on February 16, 1953.
interesting points: The light was low and traveling southeast.
The light's color stayed steady but faded and brightened several times.
The observation lasted for about 30 minutes.
There was no information provided about the altitude, speed, or exact color of the light.
The report mentions that similar flying saucer sightings have been included in local newspapers, but this one was translated and reported to the intelligence section in a timely manner.
